1_classicalMechanicsMIT.title: Classical Mechanics
1_classicalMechanicsMIT.description:
This first course in the physics curriculum introduces classical mechanics. Historically, a set of core concepts — space, time, mass, force, momentum, torque, and angular momentum — were introduced in classical  mechanics in order to solve the most famous physics problem, the motion of the planets.
The principles of mechanics successfully described many other phenomena encountered in the world. Conservation laws involving energy, momentum and angular momentum provided a second parallel approach to solving many of the same problems. In this course, we will investigate both approaches: Force and conservation laws.

tableOfContents.4: Drag Forces, Constraints and Continuous Systems Work and Mechanical Energy

precalculusKhanAcademy.title: Precalculus
precalculusKhanAcademy.description: The Precalculus course on Khan Academy covers a wide range of topics that are essential for building a solid mathematical foundation. The course is suitable for learners at various levels, whether you're just starting out or looking to reinforce your preexisting knowledge.

biologyKhanAcademy.title: Biology
biologyKhanAcademy.description: The Introduction to Biology course provides a comprehensive understanding of the key concepts in biology, allowing you to explore the living world and gain insights into how organisms function and interact.

chemistryKhanAcademy.title: Chemistry
chemistryKhanAcademy.description: The Chemistry course on Khan Academy offers a comprehensive and structured approach to learning fundamental chemistry concepts, starting from the basics and gradually progressing to more advanced topics.
